You can expend additional charges to enhance the spell, choosing one of the following effects:

items.name: Casting Time
entries: You expend 2 charges to change a spell that normally has a casting time of 1 {@action Magic|XPHB} action to instead be cast as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Duration
entries: You expend 1 charge to double the duration of the spell, to a maximum of 24 hours.

items.name: Range
entries: You expend 1 charge to double the range of the spell. If the spell normally has a range of Touch, you can cast it with a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Regaining Charges
entries: The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Detection Dragonmark Reservoir
item.reqAttune: by a Creature with the Mark of Detection
entries: Dragonmark Reservoirs are always embedded with a Siberys dragonshard, but come in many forms, most commonly an amulet or bracelet bearing the design of the house crest.

A Dragonmark Reservoir has 7 charges. While wearing it, you can use it to cast any spell on your {@feat Mark of Detection|EFA|Spells of the Mark} list at 1st or 2nd level, expending a number of charges equal to the level of the spell you cast. The reservoir regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is the same as the spellcasting ability for the spells you can cast with your Dragonmark feat.

item.name: Ghallanda Cauldron
item.reqAttune: by a Creature with the Mark of Hospitality
entries: Engraved with arcane sigils and imbued with ground Siberys shards, this cauldron allows you to prepare food in the blink of an eye. While you have to provide the raw materials, a Ghallanda Cauldron can mystically heat, chill, or flavor contents, allowing precise control over temperature and replicating the flavor of spices or herbs you don't possess. While cooking food in the cauldron, you can reduce its cooking time by 90%, and you gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ability checks made using {@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}.

item.name: Helm of the Sentinel
item.reqAttune: by a Creature with the Mark of Sentinel
entries: This helm has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use any of its properties. It regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Counterspell
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to expend 1 charge and establish a defensive ward with a contingent {@spell Counterspell|XPHB}. The next time you can see an unfriendly creature within 60 feet of you casting any spell that either targets you or causes you to make a saving throw, the {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} immediately takes effect whether or not you want it to, as if you had cast it using your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell. The ward ends immediately after {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} takes effect or at the next dawn.

entries.name: Protection
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to expend 1 charge and cast {@spell Protection from Energy|XPHB} on yourself.

entries.name: Deflection Field
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to expend 1 charge and cast {@spell Shield of Faith|XPHB} on yourself.

item.name: Detection Dragonmark Channel
item.reqAttune: by a Creature with the Mark of Detection
entries: This brooch is embedded with a small Siberys dragonshard, usually depicting the crest of its dragonmarked house.

While wearing a Dragonmark Channel, you can use it to cast any level 1 spell on your {@feat Mark of Detection|EFA|Spells of the Mark} list. Once you use the channel, it can't be used again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Your spellcasting ability for this spell is the same as the spellcasting ability for the spells you can cast with your Dragonmark feat.

item.name: Manor Key
entries: {@note Requires the {@feat Mark of Hospitality|EFA}}

This long key, studded with tiny Siberys dragonshards, can only be used by a creature with the {@feat Mark of Hospitality|EFA}. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to trace the outline of a door in the air with the key and cast {@spell Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion|XPHB} without requiring Material components. The spell ends after 24 hours or when you use the key to lock the door and dismiss the effect; at that time, any creatures within the mansion are expelled into an open space near its entrance. Once used, the key cannot be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Prospector's Wand
item.reqAttune: by a Creature with the Mark of Finding
entries: This Y-shaped wand, bearing the emblem of the {@feat Mark of Finding|EFA}, has 5 charges. While holding the wand, you can use any of its properties:

entries.name: Finding
entries: You can expend 2 charges to cast {@spell Locate Creature|XPHB} from it.

entries.name: Location
entries: You can expend 1 charge to cast {@spell Locate Object|XPHB} from it.

entries.name: Prospecting
entries: You can expend 1 charge to cast {@spell Locate Animals or Plants|XPHB} from it, with the following benefits.
You can describe or name a specific kind of mineral and locate it instead of a Beast or Plant.

You can specify the minimum quantity of that Beast, Plant, or mineral that you wish the spell to find within a 30-foot-radius sphere, such as "at least 3 pounds of Eberron dragonshards" or "at least five deer." You learn the direction and distance to the closest occurrence in that {@status Concentration|XPHB}, if any are present.

entries.name: Regaining Charges
entries: The wand regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Rod of Wild Dominion
item.reqAttune: by a Creature with the Mark of Handling
entries: This rod of varnished oak is capped at both ends with a Siberys dragonshard. While holding the rod, you can use any of its properties:

entries.name: Dominion
entries: You can cast {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB} from the rod. When you cast the spell in this manner, the duration increases to up to 1 hour. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell. After the rod is used to cast this spell, it can't be used to do so again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Handling
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks.

entries.name: Wild Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} from the rod.

item.name: Aereni Mask
item.reqAttune: by a Worthy Bearer
entries: This mask's intricate design links it to one of the Aereni noble lines, and the guidance it offers comes from spirits of that line. You can't attune to the mask unless those spirits judge you worthy to wear it.

An Aereni Mask is imbued with two skills when it is created. While wearing the mask, when you make an ability check using either of those skills, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

item.name: Final Messenger
entries: {@note Requires Use by a {@race Warforged|EFA}}

A delicate winged creature, this homunculus was designed to facilitate communication between warforged soldiers during the Last War. A {@creature Final Messenger|ExploringEberron24} is a Tiny Construct with an AC of 20, 6 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet. It has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and Psychic damage, and all conditions other than {@condition Unconscious|XPHB|Unconsciousness}. If it is forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, treat all its ability scores as 10 (+0). It has {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. It has no limbs and the only action it can take on its turn is the {@action Dash|XPHB} action.

If you are a warforged, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to integrate a Final Messenger into your body. While it is part of your body, the messenger cannot be targeted by any attack. You can only have one messenger attached to your body at a time. A messenger can only remain active for 8 hours after it detaches from a warforged body, after which time its energy dissipates and it gains the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. An {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} messenger must complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} while attached to a warforged, after which it regains its energy, as well as regaining all lost {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

A Final Messenger holds four pieces of data, accessible only to the warforged it is attached to. While the messenger is attached to you, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to review the data currently stored within the messenger, and if you choose to, change any or all of these data points.

items: A destination for the messenger. This can be very specific (a particular apartment in Sharn) or more general (an open marketplace).
A target individual. This could be a specific person or a category ("Any Karrnathi warforged").
A single image recorded through the eyes of a warforged attached to the messenger.
A message of up to 25 words.

entries: You can release the messenger as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, at which point it flies to its destination by the most direct route possible. Once it reaches the destination it seeks the target individual; if no target has been set, it approaches the nearest warforged.

If you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} while a Final Messenger is attached to you, it immediately detaches and seeks out its target. It retains its stored message, but replaces its stored image with the last thing you saw before dropping to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

item.name: Gloves of Storing
entries: These gloves come in pairs, each one tied to a small pocket dimension. The gloves' weight is negligible, regardless of their contents. While wearing the gloves, and holding an object that weighs no more than 20 pounds and can be held in one hand, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to store that object inside the glove's extradimensional space. When an object is stored inside the extradimensional space, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to summon it back into your empty hand. You can only store a single object in each glove's extradimensional space, for a total of two items between the pair.
If a glove is pierced or torn, it is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.

Placing the gloves inside an extradimensional space created by a {@item Bag of Holding|XDMG}, {@item Portable Hole|XDMG}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate and not behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

item.name: Quiver of Energy
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, choose one of the following damage types: Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. The first time each turn that you hit a target with a weapon attack using ammunition drawn from this quiver, the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen type.

item.name: Soarsled
entries: A soarsled is a crystalline disk 5 feet in diameter. It can carry a passenger through the air, using the same principles as the buttresses that sustain the towers of Sharn.

While within Sharn or another Syranian manifest zone, you can stand on the sled and take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to mentally activate it, causing it to hover beneath you. Once per turn, you can mentally command the hovering sled to move up to 30 feet in any direction. The sled can carry up to 400 pounds, and stops hovering when you step off it.
Each turn, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to make a DC 12 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics|XPHB}) check, moving the sled up to an additional 60 feet on a success.

While outside a Syranian manifest zone, the plane's energies rapidly fade, and the Soarsled can only be activated once, by taking a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. When it has been used to fly for a total of 10 minutes, or when you deactivate it by stepping off it, it loses its energy and can't be used again until it spends at least 8 hours in a Syranian manifest zone.

item.name: Crawling Gauntlet
entries: Crafted by the daelkyr, this gauntlet appears to be the forearm of a monstrous humanoid. When you attune to it, it surrounds your hand and forearm, fusing to your flesh.

When you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can slash with the talons on the gauntlet. On a hit, you can deal Slashing damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. Additionally, you can project an ectoplasmic duplicate of the gauntlet, allowing you to manipulate objects at a distance. While wearing this gauntlet, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} from it.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Shadow Sibling
entries: Crafted by Dyrrn the Corruptor, this black jewel-like object fuses to the center of your forehead when you attune to it. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cause the sibling to exude or retract an ectoplasmic shadow that surrounds your body and conceals you from prying eyes. While the shadow is active, Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made to see you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, and you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks made to {@action Hide|XPHB}.

In addition, when you are hit by an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one Hit Die to shield yourself. Roll the die and add the result to your AC, including against the triggering attack. This bonus lasts until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Spellburrow
entries: These scarab-like symbionts, bred by the daelkyr Valaara, have brilliant, iridescent shells. To attune to it, you must place it on your head; during the process of {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, it burrows through your skull, establishing a psychic connection with you. While it lacks human consciousness, it possesses a strange alien sentience that responds to your desires. There are tales of rare Spellburrows that possess greater knowledge and sentience; such stories sometimes end with the Spellburrow consuming the brain of the wizard who pushed it too far—but these are surely just fanciful stories!

A Spellburrow knows one cantrip of the DM's choice drawn from the Sorcerer or Warlock spell list, and you can cast this cantrip as if you know it. In addition, a Spellburrow knows one level 1 spell and one level 2 spell from the same spell list its cantrip is from. If you have the Spellcasting or Pact Magic class feature, you can cast these spells as if you had prepared them, and they don't count against the number of spells you can prepare. You can choose to use either your Intelligence modifier, or a spellcasting ability modifier you have gained from another source, for these spells.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Throwing Scarab
entries: Bred by the daelkyr Valaara, this bizarre symbiont burrows into the palm of its host, secreting razor-sharp chitin blades that can also be used as throwing weapons. When you attune to the scarab, it fuses with one of your hands, visible only as an iridescent, chitinous growth on your palm.

For every attack you make as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can extrude a shard of razor-sharp chitin from the symbiont into your empty hand, using it for the attack. The shard counts as a magical Simple Melee weapon with which you are proficient. It has the {@itemProperty F|XPHB|Finesse}, {@itemProperty L|XPHB|Light}, and {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} properties with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, it deals {@damage 1d4} Piercing damage and {@damage 1d4} Acid damage. The shard dissolves as soon as it hits or misses its target.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Tongueworm
entries: This coil of muscle terminates in a sharp barb. When you attune to it, this daelkyr-bred worm attaches to your throat and nestles under your tongue. You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} with the worm, using your choice of Strength or Dexterity for the attack. On a hit, you deal Piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), instead of the normal damage of an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. In addition, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Wandering Eye
entries: This disturbing daelkyr-made symbiont is a leathery tentacle with one end terminating in a single bulbous eye, and the other sporting a barb designed to burrow into flesh. When you attune to the eye, it burrows into one of your shoulders, then rises up from it, studying the world and projecting insights into your mind. The eye may occasionally take an interest in some random element of your current environment; in this case, the DM may draw your attention to this object or person.
While the eye is uncovered, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Always Vigilant
entries: The eye remains watchful while you sleep. When you take a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, the eye remains active, allowing you to use your Passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) score to notice threats even while asleep. If the eye spots danger, it sends you a mental alarm in the form of a nightmare that immediately wakes you up.

entries.name: Periscopic Vision
entries: The eye can stretch up to 18 inches and can be used to peer around corners or over cover. When extended and used in this way, the eye has an AC of 20 and 6 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If it is forced to make an ability check or a saving throw, it uses your statistics. If it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you cannot benefit from any of the eye's properties until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, after which it regains all lost {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Third Eye
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) or Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check involving sight, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Houseward (Uncommon)
entries: {@note Requires the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA}}

This engraved block of lead, approximately 1 cubic foot in size, holds an embedded Siberys dragonshard. The Houseward provides state-of-the-art magical security, and is typically embedded into the floor of the building it is supposed to protect. If any creature with the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA} spends 10 minutes touching the Houseward, it can cast {@spell Guards and Wards|XPHB} without requiring Material components. A 2,500 square foot area is protected by the spell. The duration of the spell is 24 days, but the effect ends early if the Houseward is used again to cast the spell, if a creature with the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA} spends 10 minutes touching the Houseward to end its effects, or if a Houseward is removed from the area it is currently protecting. After being used to cast the spell, the Houseward can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Houseward (Rare)
entries: {@note Requires the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA}}

This engraved block of lead, approximately 1 cubic foot in size, holds an embedded Siberys dragonshard. The Houseward provides state-of-the-art magical security, and is typically embedded into the floor of the building it is supposed to protect. If any creature with the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA} spends 10 minutes touching the Houseward, it can cast {@spell Guards and Wards|XPHB} without requiring Material components. A 5,000 square foot area is protected by the spell. The duration of the spell is 24 days, but the effect ends early if the Houseward is used again to cast the spell, if a creature with the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA} spends 10 minutes touching the Houseward to end its effects, or if a Houseward is removed from the area it is currently protecting. After being used to cast the spell, the Houseward can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Houseward (Legendary)
entries: {@note Requires the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA}}

This engraved block of lead, approximately 1 cubic foot in size, holds an embedded Siberys dragonshard. The Houseward provides state-of-the-art magical security, and is typically embedded into the floor of the building it is supposed to protect. If any creature with the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA} spends 10 minutes touching the Houseward, it can cast {@spell Guards and Wards|XPHB} without requiring Material components. A 10,000 square foot area is protected by the spell. The duration of the spell is 24 days, but the effect ends early if the Houseward is used again to cast the spell, if a creature with the {@feat Mark of Warding|EFA} spends 10 minutes touching the Houseward to end its effects, or if a Houseward is removed from the area it is currently protecting. After being used to cast the spell, the Houseward can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Coat of Many Eyes (Uncommon)
item.reqAttune: , Evolves with Service to Belashyrra
entries: This armor is a creation of the daelkyr Belashyrra, the Lord of Eyes. Made from a tough, leathery material, the coat is warm to the touch and covered with eyes—eyes of many different types of creatures, constantly glancing around as it studies your surroundings. When you attune to the armor, it binds itself to your flesh and shares its insight, granting the following benefits:

items.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

items.name: Eyes Everywhere
entries: The armor lets you see in all directions, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sight.

items.name: Gifts of the All-Seer
entries: All Coats of Many Eyes are linked to Belashyrra, and while wearing one you may receive visions—flashes of things the Lord of Eyes wishes to see through you. If you follow through with these tasks, your armor can evolve, gaining additional powers and increasing its effective rarity.

items.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Coat of Many Eyes (Rare)
item.reqAttune: , Evolves with Service to Belashyrra
entries: This armor is a creation of the daelkyr Belashyrra, the Lord of Eyes. Made from a tough, leathery material, the coat is warm to the touch and covered with eyes—eyes of many different types of creatures, constantly glancing around as it studies your surroundings. When you attune to the armor, it binds itself to your flesh and shares its insight, granting the following benefits:

items.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

items.name: Eyes Everywhere
entries: The armor lets you see in all directions, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sight.

items.name: Gifts of the All-Seer
entries: All Coats of Many Eyes are linked to Belashyrra, and while wearing one you may receive visions—flashes of things the Lord of Eyes wishes to see through you. If you follow through with these tasks, your armor can evolve, gaining additional powers and increasing its effective rarity.

items.name: Rare
entries: A rare coat also grants you a +1 bonus to AC and allows you to see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures and objects within 120 feet.

items.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Coat of Many Eyes (Very Rare)
item.reqAttune: , Evolves with Service to Belashyrra
entries: This armor is a creation of the daelkyr Belashyrra, the Lord of Eyes. Made from a tough, leathery material, the coat is warm to the touch and covered with eyes—eyes of many different types of creatures, constantly glancing around as it studies your surroundings. When you attune to the armor, it binds itself to your flesh and shares its insight, granting the following benefits:

items.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

items.name: Eyes Everywhere
entries: The armor lets you see in all directions, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sight.

items.name: Gifts of the All-Seer
entries: All Coats of Many Eyes are linked to Belashyrra, and while wearing one you may receive visions—flashes of things the Lord of Eyes wishes to see through you. If you follow through with these tasks, your armor can evolve, gaining additional powers and increasing its effective rarity.

items.name: Very Rare
entries: A very rare coat also grants you a +1 bonus to AC and allows you to see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures and objects within 120 feet. Additionally, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast {@spell Arcane Eye|XPHB} with it. Once you cast the spell in this manner, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Symbiotic Nature
entries: Once you attune to this symbiote, you can't remove it unless you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Blast Disk (Common)
entries: A Blast Disk holds destructive arcane power. A typical Blast Disk is about nine inches in diameter and one inch thick, made from layers of different metal; dragonshards are embedded in the surface of the disk and arcane symbols are engraved in its surface. Anyone studying the surface of the disk can make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) check corresponding to the save DC of the disk. On a success, they identify the spell effect contained within the disk.
There are three elements to a Blast Disk: the trigger, the payload, and the charge. Each effect is selected at the time it is created.

entries.name: Trigger
entries: A spellcaster touching a Blast Disk can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to activate it. However, generally you don't want to be holding a Blast Disk when it goes off. A Blast Disk can be created with one of the following triggers, or with a more complex trigger of the creator's choosing (e.g. to detonate when a certain word is spoken, when a specific object comes within range, etc.):

items.name: Time
entries: When the disk is activated, the user can set a time delay of up to 10 minutes before it releases its effect.

items.name: Proximity
entries: 30 seconds after the disk is activated, it can trigger when someone comes within a certain distance of the disk or when someone first makes contact with the disk, then breaks that contact.

items.name: Impact
entries: The activated disk can be set to detonate on impact, then used by throwing or dropping it.

entries.name: Payload
entries: When the Blast Disk is triggered, it produces one of the following magical effects, chosen when it was manufactured:

items.name: Explosive
entries: This creates an explosion in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on the disk. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. An explosive Blast Disk deals triple damage to objects or structures. The damage type is set when the disk is created.

items.name: Spell Effect
entries: The disk produces a spell effect when triggered. The effect must target either a single creature—whoever triggers the disk—or an area of effect centered on the disk. The level of the spell in the disk determines the saving throw DC and attack bonus, as well as the item's rarity, as shown on the Blast Disk Power table.

items.name: Charge
entries: A typical Blast Disk holds a single charge, the dragonshards shattering when the effect is triggered. However, more advanced Blast Disks recharge at dawn; this increases the rarity of the disk by one category.

items.name: Disarming a Disk
entries: When used on the battlefield, Blast Disks are typically buried or hidden. Finding the disk requires a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check, with a DC equal to the ability check that was used when it was hidden, such as Wisdom ({@skill Nature|XPHB}) or Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}). To disarm a Blast Disk, a character with proficiency in {@skill Arcana|XPHB} must succeed on a Dexterity check using {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, with a DC equal to the save DC of the disk. If the check is failed by 5 or more, the disk detonates as if it were triggered. Successfully disarming a Blast Disk expends one charge, meaning most Blast Disks will be rendered inert after disarming.

language.name: Skin Cant
entries: This is a rare language that can only be "spoken" by shapechangers, though other creatures can learn to understand it. Skin Cant uses shifting patterns of scars, tattoos, and pigment. This allows you to convey a short message—a concept that can be expressed in six words or less—to anyone who knows the language and who can see you. Typically the message is something you maintain as part of your appearance; for example, in crafting your image, you might add a pattern of scars that tells other changeling travelers, "I need help" or "Everything I say is a lie.

You can also use this language to have a conversation—typically by manifesting symbols on the palm of your hand—with someone who is within 60 feet and able to see you. The shifting patterns can be noticed by other observers within 60 feet; if you wish to keep the conversation discrete, you can hide it with a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check opposed by the observer's Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB} or {@skill Insight|XPHB}) check. If you fail, it means the observer notices your shifting patterns, though they don't understand the meaning unless they also know Skin Cant.
